Package wiffleballScorekeeper.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
wiffleballScorekeeper.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
This main Game class is a representation of a game of wiffleball. It makes use of the Count and Team classes also found in the wiffleballScorekeeper.game package.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean
    isGameOver
    Boolean flag indicating whether or not this game has ended.

    Game(int numInnings, String homeTeamName, String awayTeamName)

  • Field Details

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver
      Boolean flag indicating whether or not this game has ended.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int numInnings, String homeTeamName, String awayTeamName)
      Initializes a newly started game against the provided team names, that will last the given number of innings. Having the number of innings be an input parameter allows the game length to vary as desired.
      Parameters:
      numInnings - The desired number of innings for the game to be played.
      homeTeamName - The desired name for the home team. Can only be a maximum of 10 characters.
      awayTeamName - The desired name for the away team. Can only be a maximum of 10 characters.

  • Method Details

    • callBall

      public void callBall()
      Implementation of a ball being called and the batter being walked if applicable. This game's Count is increased by one ball, and if a walk is determined, the runners are advanced, and the isGameOver condition is update. If the game is not determined to be over, the count is reset.

    • callStrike

      public void callStrike()
      Implementation of a strike being called and the batter being struckout if applicable. This game's Count is increased by one strike. If a strikeout is determined, an out is recorded, the isGameOver condition is updated, and the count is reset. If the game is to continue and the current half-inning has ended, a new half-inning is began.

    • advanceRunnersHit

      public void advanceRunnersHit(int numBases)
      Implementation of all runners advancing by the given number of bases. This method is used for hits. Any runners resulting in a score are recorded, and the isGameOvercondition is updated. The count is also reset
      Parameters:
      numBases - The total number of bases that each runner should advance as the result of a hit.

    • flyOut

      public void flyOut()
      Implementation of an out being recorded via flyout. The out is recorded, the isGameOver condition is updated, and the count is reset. If the game is to continue and the current half-inning has ended, a new half-inning is also began.

    • groundOut

      public void groundOut()
      Implementation of an out being recorded via groundout. The out is recorded, the isGameOver condition is updated, and the count is reset. If the game is to continue and the current half-inning has ended, a new half-inning is also began.

    • display

      public void display()
      Prints this games current state to the console, formatted to look like a scoreboard. The inning, and baserunners are displayed along with the runs, hits, and walk totals for each team.

    • displayFinal

      public void displayFinal()
      Prints the final game state to the screen, formatted to look like a boxscore. The runs, hits, and walk totals for each team are displayed, along with their number of runs scored in each inning.
